document.masterDocTitle: The genus Phyllophaga Harris (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Melolonthinae) in the Colombian Andean Mountains

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Phyllophaga Harris (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Melolonthinae) in the Colombian Andean Mountains

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 3–10.
Phyllophaga obsoleta
diagnostic structures. Dorsal view of pronotum (3), left antenna (4), pro, meso, and metalegs (5), right protarsal claw (6) dorsal view of abdomen apex (7), frontal view (8), lateral view of male genital capsule (9), transversal view (10). Scale: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments. Frey ( 1975 ) states that
P. oxypygus Burmeister, 1855
and
P. longicornis Burmeister, 1855
described from "Columbien", are synonyms of
P. obsoleta .
As a result, the replacement name
P. mecocerus Blackwelder, 1944
) (for
P. longicornis Burmeister, 1855
) was also placed in synonymy (Morón and Vallejo 2007 ). This species is widely distributed from the south of the United States of America to Venezuela and Colombia : Department of Antioquia, municipalities of Rionegro, Marinilla, El Santuario, Guarne, El Carmen de Viboral, San Vicente , El Retiro, La Ceja, La Unión, Medellín, Caldas.
Phyllophaga obsoleta
is widely distributed in Colombia . It is known to be univoltine and has been registered as a pest to coffee, potato, corn, beans, pasture, and ornamental flower crops in the Colombian Andes (Vallejo et al. 1998 ), between altitudes of 1,000 to 2,600 m .

Vallejo et al. ( 1998 ) provide a description of the mature larvae, pupae, and adults, including a brief comment on the nutrition preferences of the species and an analysis of its spatial and temporal distribution in the west of the Department of Antioquia.
